original:

With the following changes:

OpenPGP: Sign Selection to New Window
OpenPGP: Encrypt Selection to New Window
OpenPGP: Decrypt Selection to New Window

menu items are only active for three applications:

com.apple.Safari
com.google.Chrome
org.mozilla.firefox

since then (I put in a de version, but identical to en though I inserted
the former version as comments)

Merge pull request #17 from idodeclare/progressDialog_v1

Improve signed file/signature file heuristic

Improve signed file/signature file heuristic

- previously, did search for smaller filename before searching
  for longer filename. I.e., searched by removing extension
  first.
- now searching for an added extension first is more reliable
  in case a signed-encrypted file has been decrypted in the
  directory.

E.g., if a directory contains out, out.gpg, and out.gpg.sig, and
the user was verifying out.gpg, the old heuristic would see
out as the signed file and out.gpg as the signature file.

The new heuristic will match the longer name first, so it would
correctly process out.gpg as the data and out.gpg.sig as the
signature.

Merge pull request #16 from idodeclare/progressDialog_v1

Add progress dialog to GPGServices. Now async files operations.

Remove large file warning dialog now that progress dialog exists

also:
- improving mechanics of describing operation

Verification logic moves to GPGServices: now cancelable and growled

- decryptFiles now growls any signatures if possible, instead of
  opening a window
- adjust parameter so growl windows show GPGServices icon

- additional thread-safety in DummyVerificationController
- FileVerificationController now thread-safe for calls from
  workers (though actually now deprecated and unused)
No focus ring on cancel button. Use serviceWorkerArray directly.

File methods are asynchronous and cancelable with progress dialog

Also:
- a tweak so 0 byte decrypted files aren't written on GPG error
- MB is now 1.e6 in line with Apple's change
- some NSLogs are now GPGDebugLogs
- "Encryption will take a long time." is now
  "Encryption may take a longer time."

Merge pull request #15 from idodeclare/improveDecryptErrorHandling

decryptFiles writes data it gets, even on error. Improve message.

decryptFiles writes data it gets, even on error. Improve message.

- summary shows "Decrypted ... file(s)" plus now "Problems with ... file(s)."
- non-Growl users also see file-level error message (in summary)
- also produce a message for NSException (in addition to GPGException)

strings changes:
- "Finished decrypting %i file(s)" -> "Decrypted %i file(s)."
- "Problems with %i file(s)." new
- "Decryption error" new for previously-silent NSException
- "An unexpected error occurred while decrypting." new for NSException
